comment.author: 14343849@N05
comment._content: I hope they were happier than they looked! What a glimpse into the past or part of it!

comment.author: 14343849@N05
comment._content: Since it's in Australia, I'm guessing they are part aboriginal or Maori. The Ossetians are from Iran and most Iranians I know only look like Sephardic Jews, but not that much, due to intermarrying with Greeks--they don't look Semitic, usually. Also, Iranian migration to places like Australia wasn't much until around 1980, after the Revolution. As for Jews, most of those who emigrated to Australia were Ashkenazi Jews (those who had settled in Europe and Russia) and would have been lighter of hair and skin due to assimilation with Norther Europeans and Slavs. The Sephardic population (from Asia and north Africa) is minimal in Australia. There were only a little over 5,000 Jews in 1861 and most of those were Ashkenazi. My bet is that they are Maori. These people look well off, which would track with the preferential treatment given to Maori, compared to indigenous Australians. For more on this: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%C4%81ori_in_Australia Do you know the Kiwi actor Cliff Curtis? He played Pablo Escobar in "Blow" and looked so much like the Colombian drug lord it's unbelievable. These people also look part Hispanic, part South American Indian, so maybe they're also Maori, like Curtis. For a photo of him, check out this link: www.imdb.com/name/nm0193295/ Interesting puzzle!

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: Sorry Greg, definitely a Jewish family. The Wikipedia article says that even by 1933 there were only 197 Maori living in Australia and most, if not all of them wouldn not have been as wealthy as the Harris family here.

comment._content: Investigating shape of the "Russian" aristocracy, (before the revolution in 1917) came to the conclusion ... Most of them belonged to the Semitic group.  Expect that they belonged to the Maori, is not necessary ;)
